title: Decision Support Factory: Making Reliable Estimates for Business Choices
hook: The fastest way to become a trusted AMS provider is to stop answering with opinions — and start delivering decision packs that survive scrutiny.
idea: Modern SAP AMS runs a small ‘decision support factory’: consistent templates, comparable options, transparent assumptions, and post-decision learning. This turns AMS into a reliable advisor across stakeholders and vendors.
what_business_needs_from_ams: Cost, risk, and time-to-value in the same language every time
A way to compare requests across domains fairly

estimation_language.rule: If uncertainty is high, widen the band and list the missing facts.

option_comparison_fields: Who benefits and who is affected
Lock-in delta (more SAP-core vs more open edge)

prioritization_for_decisions.decision_rule: If it reduces top demand drivers, it gets priority unless risk is extreme.

behavioral_rules: Always include ‘do nothing’ as a baseline option
Always propose verification signals up front
Never promise what you cannot measure
Track outcomes and admit misses early

rules: All options must declare which vendor surface is touched
Dependency time separated from execution time
No vendor narratives; only evidence-backed constraints
Arbitration uses shared SLOs and contracts

post_decision_learning.why: Trust compounds when decisions improve over time.
loop: Record decision pack and chosen option
Update estimation heuristics and KB atoms
Publish a short ‘what we learned’ note

copilot_moves: Draft decision packs from intake + historical data.
Suggest comparable past decisions and outcomes.
Estimate run cost delta from incident families impacted.

metrics_that_show_trustworthiness: Reduction in ad-hoc ‘quick asks’ (because the process is trusted)
design_question: If a CFO challenged our recommendation tomorrow, could we defend it with assumptions, evidence, and measured outcomes?
